commit_message:
Build oslo.context RequestContext

During the request, an oslo.context RequestContext is created.
This allows the log to contain the request ID as set by the
request_id middleware.

Change-Id: Ib27d91c20a58a48d611a7c0b42134f4970ff42a8
Closes-Bug: 1485604
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/11/218511/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_context import context as oslo_context # The request context stores itself in thread-local memory for logging. oslo_context.RequestContext( request_id=request.environ.get('openstack.request_id'))

commit_message:
Correct docstring for common.authorization

The docstring for the common.authorization module was incomplete
because it was missing several fields that are put into the
auth context dict.

Change-Id: Ib60cfd9989d55f2be3faa122728431ca93a98813

commit_message:
go: improve replication logging

Make REPCONN return more sensical response codes.
Log errors in REPCONN handler.
Track and log files and amount of data transferred by replicator.
Sneak in not calculating hashes for handoff replication, since I noticed I
forgot that.

Change-Id: I6f0ceee0d0b5546f7e97574579d8445beec18248
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/33/220333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: startTime time.Time replicationCount, jobCount, dataTransferred, filesTransferred uint64 replicationCountIncrement, jobCountIncrement, dataTransferAdd chan uint64 partitionTimes sort.Float64Slice partitionTimesAdd chan float64 r.dataTransferAdd <- uint64(fileSize) case dt := <-r.dataTransferAdd: r.dataTransferred += dt r.filesTransferred += 1 if r.dataTransferred > 0 { r.LogInfo("Data synced: %d (%.2f kbps), files synced: %d", r.dataTransferred, (float64(r.dataTransferred)/1024.0)*8.0, r.filesTransferred) } r.dataTransferred = 0 r.filesTransferred = 0 partitionTimesAdd: make(chan float64), replicationCountIncrement: make(chan uint64), jobCountIncrement: make(chan uint64), dataTransferAdd: make(chan uint64),
deleted_lines: startTime time.Time replicationCount, jobCount uint64 replicationCountIncrement, jobCountIncrement chan uint64 partitionTimes sort.Float64Slice partitionTimesAdd chan float64 partitionTimesAdd: make(chan float64), replicationCountIncrement: make(chan uint64), jobCountIncrement: make(chan uint64),

commit_message:
Remove and deprecate conductor compute_node_create()

Now that the one and only call to create a compute node record in
resource tracker has been converted to objects[1], the old method
in conductor can be cleaned out.

[1] commit 2ef014eb313396cffb73fc52f5cea6b5a2151da7

Related to blueprint liberty-bump-object-and-rpcapi-versions

Change-Id: I6f8043efcc5928d7e42bc32b638bbd4e782a1e2a

commit_message:
Improve logging for VMs to identify IPA issues

Since the coreos config drive issue has been solved elsewhere
we shall re-use the line to improve our logging so we can have
useful configdrive logs.

Change-Id: I0e044121e146f3036aa6b1830983dd9d7a68e9ac
Depends-On: I76a2a23e2a75022bae3511700c81145b5cbeae77

deleted_lines: - name: "For agent, disable coreos.configdrive" lineinfile: dest=/etc/ironic/ironic.conf insertafter="[agent]" regexp='^(.*)agent_pxe_append_params=(.*)$' line="agent_pxe_append_params=coreos.configdrive=0" - name: "For agent, disable coreos.configdrive"

subject: Drop unused conductor manager vol_usage_update() mock
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-30 13:09:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5115c433a03070ef942994184a5fa4e545607da8', 'message': 'Drop unused conductor manager vol_usage_update() mock

A recent change replaced calls to conductor method vol_usage_update()
with objects calls. One mock was mistakenly left in place and must be

commit_message:
Drop unused conductor manager vol_usage_update() mock

A recent change replaced calls to conductor method vol_usage_update()
with objects calls. One mock was mistakenly left in place and must be
removed before the method itself can be dropped in an upcoming
conductor rpc major version bump.

Change-Id: I2881189c904110a9f8aa85af266916d243de7586

commit_message:
Remove unused parameter overwrite in elevated

Nova uses overwrite in constructor of RequestContext to
update thread's local context or not, we don't need it
in method elevated, due to we never replace thread's local
context when get a copy with current context.

Change-Id: Ia85dfc4ddf4d4d31a7367c1ff90da118f503ba09

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Mongodb storing config overrides in /var/run

Mongodb currently writes configuration changes to '/var/run'
- not good location given that it's a volatile directory.

The overrides should be written next to the main configuration file in
/etc

Change-Id: Iaca9cc9e3ce1e6521839062fc9458c1b987f9464
Closes-Bug: 1485158

commit_message:
Bump the version of python-muranoclient to 0.7.0

A new release of muranoclient is out, having several new features
implemented. Other projects (such as murano-dashboard and murano
itslef) have to bump the minimum version of muranoclient to utilize
these features.
This patch bumps the minimum requirement and pins upper contraint to
the same value.

Change-Id: I270a9d8c321556db6da747e652d034b14390b83f

commit_message:
Initial Heat template for CoreOS Mesos cluster.

The template provisions a Mesos cluster with Marathon and Docker.
User should create a coreos-mesos cluster using below heat-templates.

A provisioned Mesos cluster consists of following processes running...
* Zookeeper: A distributed configuration and service discovery service.
* Mesos-master: A process for orchestrating the running of tasks on slaves.
* Marathon: A cluster-wide init and control system for services.
* Docker: The container engine.
* Mesos-slave: A process for running tasks.

Change-Id: I5fa28e812c3ff45e6f37c243a684a57b8e276e3b
Partial-Implements: blueprint mesos-bay-with-coreos

commit_message:
OVS agent: handle deleted ports on each rpc_loop iteration

Currently rpc loop processes ports only in case polling is required
(message from ovsdb monitor) or there are port_updated notifications from
server or security group notifications.
In case of just port_deleted notifications port processing is not
triggered during rpc loop.
This may lead to agent accumulating a big amount of deleted ports
and processing all of them at once during next iteration when polling is
required or any notification from server, which might be quite tough for
the agent. Tough means agent will be irresponsive while processing deleted
ports.
The patch makes port deletion processing more gradual.

Closes-Bug: #1491922
Change-Id: I0e1f6dfbf5b56fb18a978d6214e1768560d8ac98

commit_message:
Revise TFTP settings and note configuration

Revising the tftp settings to utilize tftp-hpa's secure mode and to
have explicit file paths.  Added note to give additional context
with regards to tftp-hpa's user privilege behavior.

Change-Id: I1f4c782de3851d1e86c22e972fb7c319b3ad07d0

commit_message:
Move Redhat-specific libvirt tasks into file to be included

We have a number of tasks in this playbook which we perform only
on RedHat-family hosts. Move these to a separate file to be included
to enhance playbook readability & facilitate restructuring.

Change-Id: Ia53c7c7b1ffcdded8ddadbf39c6e16010fb552b2
